ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: This is the best class for anyone who wants to learn how to read classical Chinese materials. I will recommend this class to others.

It is a very demanding course in terms of workload, but learning how to read and analyze primary source documents is a very useful skill to have for a historian of China. The hard work pays off once you are able to understand the significance of the text, and realize the richness of the material you are able to find within it.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This class helped me know how to read the history documents better. And this class also gave me many inspiration and provided me many potential topics.

Gained valuable experience in reading historical documents in classical Chinese under the close instruction of an expert in the field. Useful to the extent that I may utilize Chinese sources in my own research (which is primarily in Japanese history).
